post.body: merb seems to be a good contender as well. I like how it is less prescriptive ... I get a more "enterprise" vibe from it too ...
sounds fascinating ... what'll be your differentiating factor vs odesk et al ? or is that trade sikrit :p
RoR does a lot of things automagically, which can be quite neat. Django seems to need a bit more of explicitness
thanx for the get well wishes ... I'm so lagging hahaha 10 days ... more like 10 daze!
have you tried Fedora 10 ? :-) I've got ext4 and Eclipse running nicely on mine ...
how'd you get Google Gears to work on Fedora 10 x86_64 ? I got my machine to dual boot but haven't gotten Gears on it ...

you a fellow odesker too ?
awesome service. btw I'm experimenting with RoR ... it's the bomb! At least when my Windows isn't bombing out ...
thanx - I feel as sick as a dog but I think I'm over the worst of it already and am in recovery mode.
oh btw my laptop is on Fedora 10 ... yum seems to have improved a lot.
haha nice blogging platform ... interesting!
relocating? Wah ... good luck with the move! Soon it'll be time to get boxes & lorries ...
merb needs better books ... see http://www.djangobook.com/. (btw I didn't like the approach in the book!)
Experimenting with merb ... the RSpec testing framework gives a very "enterprise-y" feel to it
